thread.title: Split Fiction is a game for a more mature audience than It Takes Two
thread.title_full: Split Fiction is a game for a more mature audience than It Takes Two

author: Aroged
title: Split Fiction is a game for a more mature audience than It Takes Two
text:
In December, the long-awaited announcement of a new game from Hazelight Studios took place. They presented the Split Fiction project, which should be released on March 6, 2025. This is again a cooperative game that involves active interaction between players, like the studio’s previous project, It Takes Two. But the rating of the new game is more adult.
IMDA, which ranks games in Singapore, has given Split Fiction a 16+ rating. It Takes Two was rated General (suitable for all ages). The 16+ rating means that Split Fiction may contain blood, strong language and mild violence.
The main characters of the game Split Fiction will be two young writers – Mio and Zoe. One of them was creating fantasy, the other worked in the science fiction genre. As a result, they find themselves in the worlds of their own “mixed” stories, where they must undergo various challenges, fight enemies and solve puzzles.
Split Fiction is being developed on Unreal Engine 5; the game’s Steam page does not list a Russian localization.
topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->online media outlet
